meaningMnemonic: <kanji>Jasmine</kanji> <kanji>child</kanji> is one way to write the girl's name <vocabulary>Riko</vocabulary>. Imagine fashioning a child out of jasmine, and calling her Riko. Examples of people named Riko include pop star and singer Fukumoto Riko (福本 莉子) and idol and actress Nakayama Riko (中山 莉子).
readingMnemonic: You learned this reading for 莉 with the kanji, and I bet you're very familiar with this reading for 子 by now. A lot of Japanese girls' names that end in 子, too.
